title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 10.

questions.question: By whose meekness and gentleness does Paul beseech the Corinthians according to 2 Corinthians 10:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:1 states that Paul beseeches the Corinthians by the meekness and gentleness of Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:3, how do we walk?
questions.correctAnswer: In the flesh
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:3 says, 'For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh.'

questions.question: What kind of weapons does Paul say we use in our warfare according to 2 Corinthians 10:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty through God
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:4 explains that the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God.

questions.question: What does Paul say is cast down according to 2 Corinthians 10:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Imaginations
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:5 states that imaginations and every high thing that exalteth itself against the knowledge of God are cast down.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 10:7, Paul encourages us to look only on outward appearances.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:7 asks if we look on things after the outward appearance, implying we should not.

questions.question: What does Paul say he should not be ashamed of, according to 2 Corinthians 10:8?
options: Boasting of authority given by the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting of authority given by the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:8 mentions that Paul should not be ashamed to boast somewhat more of the authority given to him by the Lord.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:10, how do some describe Paul's letters?
questions.correctAnswer: Weighty and powerful
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:10 says that some say Paul's letters are weighty and powerful.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 10:12 says it is wise to compare ourselves with others who commend themselves.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:12 states that those who measure themselves by themselves and compare themselves among themselves are not wise.

questions.question: What does Paul say about boasting in 2 Corinthians 10:13?
options: He will boast according to the measure of the rule God distributed
He will boast of others' work
He will not boast at all
questions.correctAnswer: He will boast according to the measure of the rule God distributed
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:13 states that Paul will not boast without measure but according to the measure of the rule God has given.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:14, Paul says he stretches himself how far?
options: As far as to you also
questions.correctAnswer: As far as to you also
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:14 says Paul does not stretch beyond his measure but has come as far as to them in preaching the gospel.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 10:18 says that self-commendation is what approves a person.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:18 says that not he who commendeth himself is approved, but whom the Lord commendeth.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Corinthians 10:17: 'But he that glorieth, let him glory in the ____.'
questions.correctAnswer: Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:17 says, 'But he that glorieth, let him glory in the Lord.'

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:2, Paul does not want to be bold with what kind of confidence when present?
options: A confidence to be bold against some
questions.correctAnswer: A confidence to be bold against some
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:2 says Paul beseeches that he may not be bold with that confidence wherewith he thinks to be bold against some.

questions.question: What does Paul say he is like in presence among the Corinthians in 2 Corinthians 10:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Base
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:1 states Paul is base among them in presence but bold when absent.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:15, Paul has hope of being enlarged by the Corinthians according to what?
questions.correctAnswer: Our rule
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:15 says Paul hopes to be enlarged by them according to their rule abundantly.

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is feeling discouraged by criticism and doubts about their faith. Based on 2 Corinthians 10, what biblical truth would you share about spiritual warfare?
options: Our weapons are not worldly but have divine power to demolish strongholds
We should fight physical battles to defend our faith
Our confidence comes from human strength and wisdom
We must rely on outward appearances to prove our faith
questions.correctAnswer: Our weapons are not worldly but have divine power to demolish strongholds
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 10:3-5 teaches that though we live in the flesh, our warfare is spiritual, using divine weapons that demolish strongholds and take thoughts captive to obey Christ.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 10 instruct believers to handle disobedience within the church community?
options: Be ready to take revenge once obedience is fulfilled
Avoid correcting others to keep peace
questions.correctAnswer: Be ready to take revenge once obedience is fulfilled
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that there is readiness to avenge all disobedience once the obedience of the believers is complete, indicating correction and discipline should be timely and measured.

questions.question: Based on 2 Corinthians 10, what attitude should a believer have when comparing themselves to others?
options: Avoid comparing themselves to others as it is unwise
Always compare to be sure they are better
Boast about being superior to others
Ignore all standards and do as they please
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid comparing themselves to others as it is unwise
questions.explanation: Verse 12 warns against measuring or comparing oneself with others, stating that those who do so are not wise, encouraging humility and self-awareness.

questions.question: A believer is worried about seeming weak in person but strong in letters when sharing the gospel. What does 2 Corinthians 10 teach about consistency in words and actions?
options: They will be just as bold in deed as in word when present
Letters are more powerful than actions
Actions do not matter if the letters are strong
It is acceptable to act differently than you write
questions.correctAnswer: They will be just as bold in deed as in word when present
questions.explanation: Verse 11 encourages believers to remember that their words in letters should match their deeds in person, promoting integrity and consistency.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his manner when he is present among the Corinthians versus when he is absent?
options: Meek and gentle in presence, bold when absent
Bold and harsh in presence, meek when absent
Indifferent in presence, confident when absent
Always meek and gentle regardless of presence
questions.correctAnswer: Meek and gentle in presence, bold when absent
questions.explanation: Verse 1 explains Paul’s approach of meekness and gentleness when present, but boldness when absent to address issues firmly.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 10 say about boasting in the Lord?
options: Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord
Boasting should be about personal achievements
Boast about the works of others
questions.correctAnswer: Let him who boasts, boast in the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 17 instructs believers that any glory or boasting should be directed toward the Lord, emphasizing humility and God-centered pride.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10, why should believers not rely on self-commendation?
options: Because only the Lord commends the person
Because others will commend them instead
questions.correctAnswer: Because only the Lord commends the person
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states that approval comes not from self-commendation but from the Lord’s commendation, highlighting dependence on God's validation.

questions.question: True or False: Paul claims that he should not be ashamed to boast of the authority given by the Lord for edification, not destruction.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 8 explains that Paul is not ashamed to boast about his authority because it is given for building others up, not tearing them down.

questions.question: True or False: Some people criticized Paul’s letters as powerful but saw his physical presence as weak and his speech as contemptible.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 10 describes the criticism Paul faced regarding the difference between the power of his letters and the perceived weakness of his bodily presence and speech.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride about their ministry success. Based on 2 Corinthians 10, what should they consider about their measure of success?
options: Boast only according to the measure of the rule God has given
Boast as much as possible to show strength
Boast about others’ work as your own
Ignore all measures and do what feels right
questions.correctAnswer: Boast only according to the measure of the rule God has given
questions.explanation: Verses 13-15 emphasize boasting only within the measure God has assigned, focusing on humility and respect for others’ labors.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The weapons of our warfare are not _______, but mighty through God to the pulling down of strongholds.
questions.correctAnswer: carnal
questions.explanation: Verse 4 clearly states that our weapons are not carnal (fleshly or worldly) but have divine power to demolish strongholds.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 10 advise believers to bring thoughts into obedience to Christ?
options: By casting down imaginations and every high thing against the knowledge of God
By ignoring bad thoughts until they go away
By debating others about their beliefs
questions.correctAnswer: By casting down imaginations and every high thing against the knowledge of God
questions.explanation: Verse 5 instructs believers to actively reject thoughts that exalt themselves against God's knowledge and to bring every thought captive to Christ’s obedience.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about boasting in another's ministry work. What guidance does 2 Corinthians 10 provide?
options: Do not boast of other men's labors but hope to be enlarged according to your own rule
Boast about every ministry you support
Take credit for others’ work to gain favor
Ignore others' work and focus only on yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Do not boast of other men's labors but hope to be enlarged according to your own rule
questions.explanation: Verse 15-16 teach not to boast about others' labor but to hope for growth according to God’s measure and calling.

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize about his authority given by the Lord as related to the Corinthian church?
options: It is for edification, not destruction
It is for punishment and condemnation
It is a sign of superiority over others
It is to be used for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: It is for edification, not destruction
questions.explanation: In verse 8, Paul clarifies that his authority is intended to build up the church, not to tear it down.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 10 suggest we discern true spiritual authority?
options: By how many followers one has
questions.correctAnswer: By God’s commendation, not self-commendation
questions.explanation: Verse 18 emphasizes that true approval and authority come from the Lord’s commendation, not from self-praise.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 10.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:4, what type of weapons does Paul say are used in spiritual warfare?
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty through God
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts carnal weapons with those mighty through God to pull down strongholds, emphasizing spiritual rather than physical warfare (2 Corinthians 10:4).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:5, what must be cast down and brought into captivity?
options: Every high thing exalted against the knowledge of God
questions.correctAnswer: Every high thing exalted against the knowledge of God
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalts itself against the knowledge of God, bringing every thought captive to Christ's obedience (2 Corinthians 10:5).

questions.question: What attitude does Paul beseech the Corinthians to receive him with in 2 Corinthians 10:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Meekness and gentleness of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul appeals by the meekness and gentleness of Christ when he speaks of his manner among them (2 Corinthians 10:1).

questions.question: How does Paul describe his presence among the Corinthians in 2 Corinthians 10:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Weak and contemptible
questions.explanation: Paul's opponents say his letters are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak and his speech contemptible (2 Corinthians 10:10).

questions.question: What does Paul warn those who trust in themselves as if they alone belong to Christ to do in 2 Corinthians 10:7?
options: Ignore others who belong to Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Think again about their claim
questions.explanation: Paul challenges those who confidently trust in themselves as if they alone belong to Christ to reconsider, affirming that all who belong to Christ share that belonging (2 Corinthians 10:7).

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:12, what criticism does Paul make of those who commend themselves?
options: They are not wise because they compare themselves among themselves
They preach the gospel with power
questions.correctAnswer: They are not wise because they compare themselves among themselves
questions.explanation: Paul states that those who measure and compare themselves among themselves lack wisdom (2 Corinthians 10:12).

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize about boasting in 2 Corinthians 10:17?
options: To glory only in the Lord
To glory in one's own achievements
To glory in wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: To glory only in the Lord
questions.explanation: Paul insists that the one who glories should glory in the Lord alone (2 Corinthians 10:17).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 10:3, Paul teaches that believers wage war using physical weapons.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that though believers walk in the flesh, they do not war after the flesh, implying spiritual warfare rather than physical (2 Corinthians 10:3).

questions.question: What does Paul say about his boasting according to the measure God has given him in 2 Corinthians 10:13?
options: It is according to the measure of the rule God distributed
It is unlimited and without measure
It is focused on other apostles' work
It is to condemn the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: It is according to the measure of the rule God distributed
questions.explanation: Paul explains that his boasting is measured by the rule God has distributed to him, not beyond his assigned measure (2 Corinthians 10:13).

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:6, Paul speaks of being ready to take vengeance on whom?
questions.correctAnswer: All disobedience
questions.explanation: Paul states he is ready to take vengeance on all disobedience once the Corinthians' obedience is complete (2 Corinthians 10:6).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:15, what does Paul hope will happen as the Corinthians' faith increases?
options: They will enlarge Paul according to his rule
questions.correctAnswer: They will enlarge Paul according to his rule
questions.explanation: Paul hopes that as their faith grows, they will enlarge him according to the measure of his rule (2 Corinthians 10:15).

questions.question: What does Paul say about boasting in 2 Corinthians 10:8?
options: He would not be ashamed to boast of the authority given by the Lord
He refuses to boast at all
He boasts only in worldly power
He boasts to destroy the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: He would not be ashamed to boast of the authority given by the Lord
questions.explanation: Paul explains he would not be ashamed to boast about the authority given by the Lord, which is for edification and not destruction (2 Corinthians 10:8).

questions.question: How does Paul describe his boldness when he is absent compared to when he is present in 2 Corinthians 10:1?
options: Bold when absent, base when present
Bold both when present and absent
Base both when present and absent
Bold when present, meek when absent
questions.correctAnswer: Bold when absent, base when present
questions.explanation: Paul states that in presence he is base (humble) among them but when absent he is bold toward them (2 Corinthians 10:1).

questions.question: True or False: Paul claims in 2 Corinthians 10:18 that the Lord approves those who commend themselves.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul clearly states that it is not the one who commends himself who is approved, but the one whom the Lord commends (2 Corinthians 10:18).

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:16, Paul expresses intent to preach the gospel where?
options: In the regions beyond the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: In the regions beyond the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Paul states his aim to preach the gospel in the regions beyond them, not boasting in another man's line (2 Corinthians 10:16).

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:4, what kind of weapons does Paul say are used in the warfare of believers?
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty weapons through God
questions.explanation: Paul states that the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God for pulling down strongholds, indicating spiritual power rather than physical force. This aligns with spiritual warfare themes found in Ephesians 6:12-17, James 4:7, and Psalm 144:1.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:5, believers are instructed to cast down imaginations and bring every thought into what kind of obedience?
questions.correctAnswer: The obedience of Christ
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes that every thought should be brought into captivity to the obedience of Christ, highlighting the lordship of Christ over the believer's mind. This reflects Romans 12:2 and Philippians 2:8-11 where Christ's authority is supreme.

questions.question: What attitude does Paul appeal to when he begins his exhortation in 2 Corinthians 10:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Meekness and gentleness of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul beseeches the Corinthians by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, showing his appeal to Christ-like humility and patience, consistent with Matthew 11:29 and Galatians 5:22-23.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:7, what warning does Paul give about judging by outward appearance?
options: Do not judge others at all
If anyone trusts in themselves that they are Christ's, they should reconsider
Trust only what you see with your eyes
questions.correctAnswer: If anyone trusts in themselves that they are Christ's, they should reconsider
questions.explanation: Paul warns against superficial judgment and self-confidence in belonging to Christ without true evidence, reflecting 1 Samuel 16:7 and John 7:24 about not judging by outward appearance.

questions.question: What does Paul say about boasting in 2 Corinthians 10:8?
options: He should boast to shame others
He should boast about his authority for edification, not destruction
He should never boast at all
questions.correctAnswer: He should boast about his authority for edification, not destruction
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that any boasting he does is based on authority given by the Lord for building up the church, not tearing it down, consistent with 2 Corinthians 12:9 and Ephesians 4:29.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:10, how do Paul's opponents describe his letters and his physical presence?
options: Letters are weak; presence is powerful
Letters are weighty and powerful; presence is weak and speech contemptible
Letters are humorous; presence is inspiring
Letters and presence are both strong
questions.correctAnswer: Letters are weighty and powerful; presence is weak and speech contemptible
questions.explanation: Opponents acknowledge Paul's letters as strong, but mock his bodily presence and speech, echoing challenges Paul faced in Acts 18:27 and 2 Timothy 4:17-18.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:12, how does Paul describe those who compare themselves among themselves?
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish and unwise
questions.explanation: Paul states that those who compare themselves with one another are not wise, warning against pride and self-commendation, consistent with Proverbs 3:5-7 and James 4:6.

questions.question: What does Paul say believers should boast in according to 2 Corinthians 10:17?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that anyone who glories should glory in the Lord, emphasizing God's glory over human pride, in line with Jeremiah 9:23-24 and 1 Corinthians 1:31.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 2 Corinthians 10:3, 'For though we walk in the flesh, we do not ______ after the flesh.'
questions.correctAnswer: War
questions.explanation: Paul distinguishes physical existence ('walk in the flesh') from spiritual warfare ('do not war after the flesh'), showing that believers engage in spiritual conflict, consistent with Ephesians 6:12 and Romans 8:13.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:6, what readiness does Paul say believers should have?
options: To revenge all disobedience when obedience is fulfilled
questions.correctAnswer: To revenge all disobedience when obedience is fulfilled
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of readiness to deal with disobedience once obedience is complete, indicating discipline within the church, which aligns with Hebrews 12:5-11 and Proverbs 3:11-12.

questions.question: What is Paul's attitude toward boasting about other men's labors in 2 Corinthians 10:15?
options: He does not boast without measure and hopes for growth through them
questions.correctAnswer: He does not boast without measure and hopes for growth through them
questions.explanation: Paul refuses to boast beyond his measure or claim credit for others' work but hopes to be enlarged as their faith grows, reflecting humility and unity, as seen in 1 Corinthians 3:6-9 and Philippians 1:5.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:9, why does Paul say he writes his letters?
options: To instruct and encourage, not to terrify
questions.correctAnswer: To instruct and encourage, not to terrify
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that his letters are not meant to intimidate but to instruct, consistent with his pastoral approach seen in 1 Thessalonians 2:7-8 and Colossians 3:16.

questions.question: What measure does Paul say he uses to boast according to 2 Corinthians 10:13?
options: The measure of the rule which God distributed
questions.correctAnswer: The measure of the rule which God distributed
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of boasting according to God's rule and measure, not beyond, highlighting divine authority and calling, consistent with Romans 12:6 and Ephesians 4:7.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:16, what is Paul's mission regarding the gospel?
options: To preach the gospel in regions beyond the Corinthians
To focus only on the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: To preach the gospel in regions beyond the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Paul aims to extend the gospel beyond Corinth, emphasizing expansion of the kingdom rather than self-exaltation, consistent with Acts 1:8 and Romans 15:20.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his physical presence among the Corinthians in 2 Corinthians 10:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Base and humble
questions.explanation: Paul admits that in person he is considered 'base' among the Corinthians but bold when absent, illustrating contrasts between physical weakness and spiritual authority, as also seen in 1 Corinthians 2:3-5 and 2 Corinthians 12:9.
